sub_topic: The butterfly effect and its implications in chaotic systems
message_1:
A mathematical model used in Chaos theory for population dynamics is given by the equation: 

N(t+1) = rN(t) * [1 - (N(t) / k)]

where N(t) represents the population size at time 't', 'r' is the growth rate of the population and 'k' is the carrying capacity of the system. 

If the population size at time 't' is 100, the growth rate is 0.4 and the carrying capacity is 200, what will be the population size at time 't+3'?
